newsitem.title: JAPAN: Tokyo precious metals rise sharply as yen dips.
newsitem.headline: Tokyo precious metals rise sharply as yen dips.

text.p: Yen-based Tokyo precious metal futures extended early rises to post hefty gains by the close on Thursday, as the dollar edged up against the yen in late Tokyo trade, traders said.
Gold futures ranged from 10 yen to 15 yen per gram higher. Most-active benchmark December was up 10 yen at 1,357 yen.

"Trade house buying gained momentum later in the day as the yen tumbled, while private investors were tending to take profits on price rallies as they were not sure how much the yen would fall further before the weekend's G7 (Group of Seven) meeting," on trader said.
